name: Political Science
descriptions: With a strong foundation in the liberal arts, TCU political science majors are well suited for a variety of successful careers. Occupational opportunities include government administration, politics and campaigns, public policy, non-profit organizations, international relations, business and journalism.

TCU political science grads are also prepared to pursue graduate degrees specializing in the study of specific regions, business, law or diplomacy. Our alumni have won Fulbright scholarships and attended elite law schools and graduate programs—at Harvard, Yale, University of Chicago and many others.

internship.description: invaluable for helping sort out which career path most interests you. Local Civic Literacy Internships Civic Literacy Internships require 150 hours of service with a local governmental or nonprofit agency to receive three hours of political science credit. Eligible interns can be reimbursed up to $500 for the costs of transportation and professional clothing. Placements include: Arise Africa, CASA of Tarrant County, Congressman Roger Williams, Fort Worth
